00007 namespace
00008 {
00009     // First 14 bytes of file for file header bitmap
00010     static const unsigned int FILE_HEADER_SIZE = 14;
00011     // First 40 bytes of file for file header bitmap
00012     static const unsigned int INFO_HEADER_SIZE = 40;
00013     //  write one line
00014     static const unsigned int ONE_ROW_TO_WRITE = 1;
00015     // First 18 bytes for tga header
00016     static const unsigned int TGA_HEADER_SIZE = 18;
00017     // Last 26 bytes for tga header
00018     static const unsigned int TGA_FOOTER_SIZE = 26;
00019     // float precision
00020     static const unsigned int FLOAT_PRECISION = 3;
00021     // jpeg quality
00022     static const unsigned int DEF_JPG_QUALITY = 80;
00023 }
00024

00029 public:
00030     struct FileFormat {
00031         enum Enum {
00032                     RawData
00033 #ifdef PNG_ENABLED
00034                     , PNG
00035 #endif // PNG_ENABLED
00036                     , BMP
00037                     , TGA
00038                     , CSV
00039 #ifdef JPEG_ENABLED
00040                     , JPG
00041 #endif // JPEG_ENABLED
00042 //TODO: Due to circular dependencies this is being deactivated for now, and will be replaced by a better solution later on.
00043 //TODO: To write images into HDF files please use the WriteHdf5Image class from VtdHdf5 directly
00044 //#ifdef HDF_ENABLED
00045 //                    , HDF5
00046 //#endif //HDF_ENABLED
00047         };
00048     };
00049 
00050     static bool isFormatAvailable(const FileFormat::Enum& format);
00051 
00060 #ifdef PNG_ENABLED
00061     static bool writeRdbImageToPng(RDB_IMAGE_t& img, const std::string& filePath, int compressionLevel, int filters, bool flipped);
00062 #endif // PNG_ENABLED
00063

00065

00067 
00068     static bool writeRdbImageToBmp(RDB_IMAGE_t& img, const char* imageFileName, bool flipped);
00069 
00070     static unsigned char* createBitmapFileHeader(int height, int width, int paddingSize, unsigned int fileHeaderSize = FILE_HEADER_SIZE, unsigned int infoHeaderSize = INFO_HEADER_SIZE, unsigned int rowWidth = 3);
00071 
00072     static unsigned char* createBitmapInfoHeader(int height, int width, unsigned int infoHeaderSize = INFO_HEADER_SIZE, unsigned int rowWidth = 3);
00073

00075

00077

00080 #endif // JPEG_ENABLED
00081 //TODO: Due to circular dependencies this is being deactivated for now, and will be replaced by a better solution later on.
00082 //TODO: To write images into HDF files please use the WriteHdf5Image class from VtdHdf5 directly
00083 //#ifdef HDF_ENABLED
00084 //    static bool writeRdbImageToHdf5(RDB_IMAGE_t& img, const char* fileName, bool flipped, const std::string& imageName = "image");
00085 //#endif //HDF_ENABLED
00086 
00087     template <typename T>
00088     static void flipedData(bool flipped, T* shmData, T* newImageData, const uint32_t &imgSize, const RDB_IMAGE_t& img, uint32_t &rowWidth)
00089     {
00090         if (!shmData || !newImageData)
00091             return;
00092 
00093         if(!flipped)
00094         {
00095             std::memcpy(newImageData, shmData, imgSize);
00096         }
00097         else
00098         {
00099             rowWidth = img.width * rowWidth;
00100             T* imgRow = shmData;
00101             for(int i=0; i<img.height; ++i)
00102             {
00103                 int index = (img.height-1-i);
00104                 std::memcpy(&newImageData[index * rowWidth], imgRow, rowWidth);
00105                 imgRow += rowWidth;
00106             }
00107         }
00108     }
00109 private:
00110 
00111 };
00112 
00113 } //namespace VTD

00115 #endif //VTDFRAMEWORK_RDBIMAGEIO_H
